Readme.MD 
Verdiem Data Parser

This tool allows one to use the 2014 CalPlug Verdiem dataset to be used with the PLSim simulator program.  This is a kludge- the process is fast with this script, but not automatic, be warned!

Setup and Building:  This script uses the same IDE and rerequisites for use as the PLSim program and was developed with Miniconda3 in Eclipse.

Operation:  The dataset is assumed to be loaded into a MySQL server to query against.  Please see the script for the details of the layout of the data within the table in the database.

Part 1:  Query the device (which machine) you want the data from and restrict by date if wished.  Use default options.  You should have a display in the console window looking like this:
================================
April 07, 2014,Generic GenericPC,On,
April 08, 2014,Generic GenericPC,On,
April 09, 2014,Generic GenericPC,On,
April 10, 2014,Generic GenericPC,On,

[And More]
===============================================

Each of the 1's indicates the state was active for each 1 minute (60 second) integration period of the day.  Now for a single day, copy and paste into a text editor and format the data to look like the following:

===============================
sample_rate:60
Generic GenericPC,Off,
Generic GenericPC,On,
==============================
save the file as test_group_temp.csv - Freeze here!
What we did was generate a schedule of operation text file (CSV format) for a designated "GenericPC".  This matches a template 

Part 2:
Now fire up PLSim, we are going to make a sample schedule then replace it with the one we just generated.  In the current version of the program, you must generate a sample schedule and replace it by overwriting it.  Here is an example of the commands and prompts to do this with the "GenericPC" device:

Part 3: Now you will be seeing this prompt:
"CSV Schedule File Written - Press Enter to continue with analysis ..."
Do not hit ENTER yet!  Overwrite the test_group.csv file with the test_group_temp.csv (renamed as: test_group.csv)
Now hit ENTER to perform the analysis
